plan:
Plan:
1. Start by bidding 50% of the value as suggested by economists to establish a baseline.
2. Gradually increase the percentage to see if it leads to more wins without significantly reducing profits.
3. Test bidding a flat rate, regardless of value, to see if consistency outperforms variability.
4. Experiment with bidding aggressively at a high percentage of value to gather data on the risk-reward balance.

1. Start with the dominant strategy of bidding 50% of my value for the first 5 rounds to establish a baseline.
2. For rounds 6-10, experiment with aggressive bidding, placing bids slightly above 50% of my value.
3. For rounds 11-15, try conservative bidding, placing bids slightly below 50% of my value.
4. Analyze the results after each round, adjusting bids based on competitor behavior.
5. If consistently losing, consider more aggressive strategies.
6. If consistently winning with small profits, consider more conservative strategies.

1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid 50% of my value as suggested by economists. Analyze the bidding patterns of Andy and Betty.
2. Mid Rounds (4-9): Test aggressive strategy. If my value is high (>70), bid more than 50% value. If low (<30), bid less than 50%. Monitor outcomes.
3. Later Rounds (10-12): Test conservative strategy. Bid exactly 50% value regardless of my value. Compare results with aggressive strategy.

Plan: Continue bidding 50% of value for two more rounds. Then, increase to 60% for three rounds. Observe if this leads to more wins. Experiment with a flat rate of $40 for three rounds. Finally, bid aggressively at 80% of value for the last few rounds to assess risk-reward balance.

Continue bidding 50% of value for rounds 2-5 to establish a trend. Observe competitors' bidding patterns. If consistently winning, consider slightly lowering bid for greater profit. If losing, consider raising bid slightly. Adjust strategy accordingly for rounds 6-15 based on these observations and outcomes.
Continue bidding 50% value for round 2. For round 3, increase bid to 60% if value is high (>70) or decrease to 40% if value is low (<30). Analyze outcomes and adjust strategy accordingly.

Plan: Continue bidding 50% of value for one more round. Then increase to 60% for two rounds. If no significant wins, bid a flat rate of $40 for three rounds. Finally, bid aggressively at 80% of value for the remaining rounds to assess risk-reward balance.

For rounds 2-5, I'll continue bidding 50% of my value. From rounds 6-10, I'll increase my bids slightly above 50% to test aggressive bidding. For rounds 11-15, I'll decrease my bids slightly below 50% to observe the impact on my profits.
For round 3, I'll bid 60% if my value is high (>70) or 40% if it's low (<30). For rounds 4-6, I'll bid aggressively, up to 70% of my value if it's over 50, and monitor the outcomes.

Plan: Proceed with bidding 50% of value for this round. Increase to 60% for next two rounds. If no significant wins, bid a flat rate of $40 for three rounds. Lastly, bid aggressively at 80% of value for the remaining rounds to assess risk-reward balance.

For rounds 3-5, maintain 50% bid strategy. Post round 5, if value is high (>70), increase bid to 60% of value. If value is low (<30), decrease bid to 40% of value. For mid-range values (30-70), stick to 50% bid strategy. Adjust based on results.
For rounds 4-6, I'll bid 70% of my value if it's over 50, and 30% if it's under 50. For rounds 7-9, I'll bid 80% when value is high (>70) and 20% when it's low (<30) to compare results.

Plan: Increase bid to 60% of value for next two rounds. If no wins, test flat rate of $40 for three rounds. If still unsuccessful, adopt aggressive strategy, bidding 80% of value for remaining rounds. Analyze results to determine most profitable strategy.

For rounds 4-5, maintain the 50% bid strategy. For rounds 6-10, experiment with aggressive bidding, increasing bids to 60% of value for high values (>70) and 50% for other values. For rounds 11-15, try conservative bidding, decreasing bids to 40% for low values (<30) and 50% otherwise.
For rounds 4-6, bid 70% of value if it's over 50, and 30% if it's under 50. Rounds 7-9, bid 80% when value is high (>70) and 20% when it's low (<30). Analyze results.

Plan: Increase bid to 60% of the value for the next two rounds. If unsuccessful, test a flat bid of $40 for three rounds. Finally, bid aggressively at 80% of value for remaining rounds to assess profitability.

For rounds 5-7, I'll bid 60% of my value to test an aggressive strategy. For rounds 8-10, I'll bid 40% of my value to test a conservative strategy. I'll adjust my bidding strategy for the final rounds based on the outcomes of these experiments.

For rounds 5-6, maintain a 70% bid for values over 50 and 30% for values under 50. For rounds 7-9, increase bid to 80% for high values (>70) and decrease to 20% for low values (<30) and compare the results.

Plan: Continue with 60% of value for one more round. If unsuccessful, test a flat bid of $40 for three rounds. If no significant wins, adopt aggressive strategy of bidding 80% of value for remaining rounds. Analyze results to determine most profitable strategy.

For rounds 6-8, I'll bid 60% of my value for aggressive strategy testing. For rounds 9-10, I'll bid 40% of my value for conservative strategy testing. I'll adjust my bidding strategy for the final rounds based on these outcomes.

For rounds 6-9, I'll bid 70% for values over 50 and 30% for under 50. In rounds 10-12, I'll test conservative strategy, bidding 50% regardless of value. In the final rounds, I'll choose the most successful strategy.

Plan: Continue with 60% of value for the next round. If unsuccessful, bid a flat $40 for three rounds. If still no significant wins, adopt aggressive strategy of bidding 80% of value for remaining rounds. Adjust bids based on previous round's second highest bid to optimize profit.

For rounds 7-9, I'll bid 65% of my value, slightly increasing the aggressive strategy. For round 10, I'll revert to a 50% bid to observe the impact. For rounds 11-15, I'll implement a sliding scale strategy, adjusting the bid percentage based on the value.

For rounds 7-9, bid 80% for values >70 and 20% for values <30. For rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid. For the final rounds, adopt the most profitable strategy based on previous rounds' outcomes. Consider more aggressive bidding when value is high.

Plan: Maintain 60% of value for one more round. Then, bid a flat $40 for three rounds. Analyze results, especially second-highest bids, to adjust flat rate if needed. For remaining rounds, bid aggressively at 80% of value and adjust based on previous results to optimize profit.

Plan: Implement flat rate bid of $40 for three rounds. Analyze second-highest bids to adjust rate if needed. Finally, adopt aggressive strategy, bidding 80% of value for last two rounds. Adjust based on previous results to maximize profit.

Plan: Continue with flat rate bid of $40 for two more rounds. Analyze second-highest bids to adjust rate if needed. For the last two rounds, bid aggressively at 80% of value. Adjust based on previous results to maximize profit.

Plan: Continue with a flat rate bid of $40 for one more round. Analyze second-highest bids to adjust rate if needed. For the last three rounds, bid aggressively at 80% of value. Adjust based on previous results to maximize profit.

Plan: Implement aggressive bidding at 80% of value for remaining rounds. Adjust bid based on previous second-highest bids to optimize profit. Monitor results closely to determine if this strategy yields higher profits compared to previous strategies.

Plan: For the final round, I will adopt a less aggressive strategy, bidding just above the previous round's second-highest bid. This will allow me to win the auction while maximizing profit. I will adjust my bid based on the value for the prize in the final round.

For round 14, I'll continue with a conservative bid of 40% of my value. However, for the final round, I'll switch to an aggressive strategy, bidding 70% of my value. This approach will allow me to observe the impact of both strategies on my profits.

For round 14, bid 75% if value >70 and 25% if <30. In the final round, adopt the most profitable strategy based on prior outcomes. If value is mid-range (30-70), consider aggressive bidding (60-70%) to increase winning chances.
